ListOfPairs.Value: Jion, the old sheriff of the Colony, and Gojiir's bodyguard, has the<color=#00FF71> key card</color> to Enlil Peaks, atop Zhagros 05. I have to find him and get that key card.
Jion's clue

I have the<color=#00FF71> key card </color>that gives me access to the Nasaba Hills. I can now access the area on the far eastern side of the Ishtar temple ruins. It's time to go investigate the area.
The Nasaba Hills

I have to find the face fragments of the Kiraam statues. To be complete, they must also have an active decrypted mind. The <color=#FFF400>K-ME1</color> unit can assist me in this, and decrypt the minds.
Rebuild the statues
It's one of Gojiir's followers...
He's completely inactive... I wonder what happened?
He's dead... Was he part of Gojiir's escort?
Throat.
No.
Don't worry, I come from Nanaar, on behalf of the sheriff.
Stay away.
L...leave me.
Are you part of Gojiir's escort?
No!
I cannot listen to this any longer... just leave me be, go.
Leave... whoever you are.
We have lost Gojiir... for good.
You've seen him? Where did he go?
I've seen the horror...
The deep darkness... No...
Ha ha ha ha ha
he he he he
Oooh, you'll quintuple.
Soon, the sun will rise.
Flesh has been reborn...
I pray that Baba Rhugga's teachings will continue to live on through us...
I heard a few years ago a story about a few missionaries from the south, they said that one of them had come from Idrymatos in search of a place they called The Lost Valley.
The Lost Valley? Now that you mention it... I think Gojiir spoke about it a long time ago.
They said that the entrance is protected by the Sun and the Moon, and that in the deepest parts of the valley there are temples from ancient times.
Seems like an interesting topic to study.
You're right about that, especially as it's still a mystery...
By Mitera... What's happened this time? What's with all the fuss?
Why won't they let us through? We just want to go see Baba Rhugga...
I still remember the time when the great Babas all gathered here... under the roots of the great tree.
Elder
H…Hey, Hey there young one! Sorry, I was a little… occupied.
Don't worry! Anyway, as much as I try… it's too dense… too much… static and noise.
I'm trying to pick up the emissions from the Antena… but there is so much information, it's impossible to decipher…
Babas?
So, I see you are new around here… Is this the first time you've been sent to a data mining colony?
Pretty much, I just arrived.
The Babas, young Seeker, are pretty common entities that can be found in colonies such as this one.

They are analysts, like me. However they often, for one reason or another, decide to dedicate the rest of their days to a more… spiritual endeavour. They are considered Saints, despite their work no longer focussing on the Archive, but instead on the School of Oracles.
I'm not surprised the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color> is absent … I've never seen anything like it.
Are… Are you saying you were able to pick up these emissions?
Yes, of course… we used to convene near the emission sources and analyse them for days… But right now, the quantity of information coming out is so great that I simply cannot keep up…
Being an analyst… it shouldn't be a problem for you, you are equipped with the best databases and receptors.
And I agree with you young one… I've been to many a data mine and always been able to extract something of use for the Archive… but this time, it's different, anomalous.
How long has this been occurring for?
Well, it had slowly been getting worse until it reached this… maelstrom, it's been completely illegible for over a year…
That's why the great Babas don't even come close anymore, they have gone into exile, moving to more secluded areas.
This is a data extraction Colony, an authentic data mine <sprite name="cristal_0">

Well, you're a little late aren't you? Ha ha ha, go speak to <color=#989347>Lei</color>, she has been dealing with the<color=#D93333> Kaborist cult</color> for a while now... I do my best to stay away from them.

In regards to your question… Why is this Colony here?… The<color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color> will give you all the information you need… but mark my words, there is something suspicious happening in the shadows of this Colony…
Years ago, they found vast caverns past the ruins of Ishtar, a place, they say, that contains an enormous amount of information.
They call it “The Library”, but I have never seen it with my own lenses. However, they say it is a frightful place, where one can easily lose their path and find themselves lost…

Now that you mention it, I know for certain that<color=#D93333> Colonel Kabor</color> was there for a brief period... they say that when he left he wasn't himself any more, and he hasn't been seen around here since.
So from what I understand,<color=#D93333> Kabor</color> is... or was, a constructor. Did he work here?

Why of course young one, of course. Do you see all of these beams? It was him that brought them here and lifted them into their places… I still remember when we built the Bar, heh… he did love his Oryktum.
But that was a long time ago… still, you have no idea how sad it makes me to hear what is being said about him around here…
Did you know him personally?
No… I only saw him a few times when the Colony was still under construction.
The antena that you can see at the very top is one of the necessary components for a settlement to become a mine or a Colony.
The other component is of equal importance, a governing entity that is in charge of processing and sending the information.
In our case, this is the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>.
As I'm sure you are aware, young Seeker, the objective of these colonies, spread out strategically amongst the world, is to ensure the arrival of all extracted information to Idrymatos.
Therefore, the information is passed onto to the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>, who in turn sends it to the Antenna so it can reach its' final destination: Idrymatos.
And why is it out here in the jungle? What's so special about this place?
I see you have been told very little about this place… Why have you come here?
I've come in search of<color=#D93333> Colonel Kabor</color>, my mission is to find his whereabouts and discover what I can about the Kaborist cult.
It's better this way… he seems very busy and I have much to do.
Inquire
Leave alone
Excuse me. I don't mean to bother… Can I ask you a few questions?
Forgive my interruption.
Static and noise?
What about that Antenna?
Thank you very much for your information.
Do you have any more questions?
They've been completely crushed...
Stay alert, Seeker... they might be closer than we think.
Atsege
Baba Gojiir
It's Baba Gojiir... it seems like he's muttering something under his breath:
01100101 01110010 01110010 01101111 01110010 Transfigure, fraction, some. Restless nights, FLESH. Hahahahaha, night, infinite. The throat, exhumed, purification.
The human being, material Flesh, blood... LIFE. Omen, blessing. Hahahahaha
Who are you? I follow them, they have passed... they wait, but they will not return.
The impious dress in purple, they protect the truth. Enhance dreaming.
The boy is the decimal, he will make it quintuple, alive, then, hihihihihi
I'm sorry, deeply... profuse, data 01100101 01110010 01110010 01101111 01110010 The ray activated it.
Late rebirth.
The Hexagonal throat, hexagonal, the hexagonal throat.
Being reborn...
In the name of the Venerable Baba Kiraam, we welcome you into the embrace of his temple. May Mitera's blessings accompany you on the rest of your journeys.
Likewise, pilgrim.
May I speak with Baba Kiraam?
I'm looking for <color=#989347>Sheriff Lei</color>
The Baba's voice is too pure to be heard in public.
But as a medium, I can pass on to you his deepest worries.
Well, the three statues have lost their heads.
Their minds and bodies are intertwined, as they are the guardians of the Sun and information.
If the pilgrims wish to enter the Ishtar Ruins, the statues must be rebuilt.
You'll find the Sheriff to the east of the temple, next to the door leading towards the Nasaba Hills.
Thank you.
He looks a lot like the individual I saw earlier speaking with the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>.
He's fast asleep... No matter how hard I try, there is no way of waking him up...
The <color=#FFF400>K-ME1</color> unit's Oryktum battery has run out. I have to find a new one and replace it to reactivate the unit's decryption capabilities
Activate decryption mode
Oryktum can only be consumed in the Colony Bar.
There is a rectangular slot in the wall.
On the inside I can discern a cylindrical screw cap.
I can't see anything, it's too dark.
Wow... much better.
Seeker
Seeker 2
Does anyone know anything about who did this? Is<color=#D93333> Colonel Kabor</color> really capable of doing something like this?
Make sure to find out where the crazy colonel is... if this carries on for much longer, there won't be enough of us to keep this under control.
I'll do everything I can.

<color=#989347>Sheriff Lei</color> has left for the Jumbaba Valley in search of answers, and we are doing everything we can to figure out the whereabouts of<color=#D93333> Kabor</color> and his lackeys.
This isn't fair... he was a Saint... You barely even knew him!

My responsibilities and efforts are with <color=#989347>Lei</color>, and we are in service of both the School of Oracles and the Archive. Please, tell your people to head back to the Colony, they will be safer there.
This land is sacred!..., it doesn't matter how much you ask, we will not leave. It is you that should go back to the Colony, and allow us to purify the area...
Impossible. I'm under strict orders to remain here until further notice.
Where have you taken the body?
The Saint's body..., has been taken to the Colony for a thorough investigation, afterwards they said they will return it so that a proper funeral can be given in accordance with his beliefs.
Cat
What a mess...
We had come to see Baba Gojiir, and it seems he has gone...
Keep it moving, Seeker... I'm sure you have things to do.
Why do I have to do this? This is ridiculous.
Alright
Halt, identify yourself!
ID178914 Ludovik Subclass Seeker, operative static reference with destination C-Alpha/SynthBabel 07, 4
Well met, Seeker. It's no surprise to see that they are sending out units such as yourself with everything that is going on here. It is regretful though, that you have been assigned to this location.
Everything is in order, we will overlook the anomaly due to the circumstances... however I must first ensure that your inventory system is working correctly.
See the <color=#C05F66>gear</color> over there? Pick it up and bring it to me.

I'm sorry... it's protocol. To make sure you are able to complete your future tasks, we have direct orders from the <color=#D0B9FF>Matriarch</color> to ensure that any newcomers have all of their modules in good working condition. We already have enough scrap in here...
Perfect, everything is in order, you may pass.

I've already sent word of your arrival: A meeting has been arranged for you with the <color=#D0B9FF>Matriarch</color>. It's best you don't make her wait or wander around the colony, security around here get suspicious when they see a taskless Seeker wandering around.

And remember, the same way you've just given me the item, you can do it anywhere else. Simply go to the place you want to use the object, open your inventory using <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Inventory">, select the object and use it with <color=#00FFD9>"Use"</color>
Forward, please.

Good, the collection system is working correctly. You have now picked up the<color=#C05F66> gear</color>, if you press <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Inventory"> you can open your inventory. Your inventory automatically stores everything you pick up in the world.
To finish, come to me and open your inventory with <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Inventory">, select the <color=#C05F66>gear</color> and afterwards “Use”, to give it to me.
You can keep the<color=#C05F66> gear</color>… I just wanted to check that your inventory system worked correctly.
Request denied.
Please <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>, I beg you, I do not want to be here any longer, accept my transfer and... please, accept my most sincere apologies but... I'm scared.
You already know my answer 198432, we do not have enough functional units for you to relinquish your role as guardian of the Zhagros 05 <color=#00FF71>key card </color>.
Therefore I will proceed to close your case until further notice or new information is presented. Your request is denied, and your responsibilities as guardian continue as they were.
...Yes, <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>... (goddammit)
Next.
Irasshai 178914 Ludovik, we trust that your journey has been in accordance with the prefixed protocols of 57z Agym. Under my control, in 28/30-E
Accessing dual permissions...
Location acquired, scanning for assignments.
Your direct client is <color=#989347>Isherifu 005681 Lei</color>, Sheriff of C-Alpha/SynthBabel 07, 4. Your assignment is to contact her immediately in...
Stupid little robot... what's the problem now? No more processing power?
Of course not, you're dead, you hunk of scrap!
It's over! Put your hands where I can see them!
And soon you will all perish too! Bastards!

Had you been worthy of<color=#D93333> Colonel Kabor's</color> gift, you too would be able to contemplate the sweet serenity of true flesh. Baba Rhugga is indulging himself in it right now, right in these precious moments.
Useless piece of junk! I'm tired of your senseless degenerate ramblings! Don't you even dare mention Baba Rhugga!
The light is already beginning to emerge from the great hexagonal throat, and it's prose leaves no shadows.
This isn't going well at all... how is this possible?... fuck...
How did they manage to get this far? Isn't there anybody at the entrance to the Library?!
Go and secure the area, stay alert, make sure these deplorable fools don't take us by surprise again.
Venerable <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>, allow me to assume the burden of my mistakes.
Grant me the duty of fixing my mistakes, I implore you. They only bring me shame...
<color=#989347>Isherifu 005681 Lei</color>, the Golly-52 register indicates a significant decrease in active units within the Alpha/SynthBabel 07 colony.
It's becoming obvious that our efforts to attenuate the growing situation are inefficient. Threat no. Omicron has gone too far this time.
Yes, Venerable...

Acting in accordance with section 5489, chapter K-11 of the 14t Akynn protocol, in light of a no.8, Omicron type threat, I hereby suspend all movement of units not in possession of a Blue label outside of the limits marked by Alpha/SynthBabel 07.
I hereby declare a state of alarm.
<color=#989347>Isherifu 005681 Lei</color>, execute this order in accordance with the corresponding protocols.
...Yes Venerable...
(I have to go see Baba Rhugga, I hope what the cultist said was nothing more than their usual gibberish)
Technical problem solved. Recovering legislation alpha 2.b

<color=#989347>Lei</color> is headed for Rhugga's temple, it is located in the Mount of Visions. First you must find the route's guard, search for him here in the Colony. He is the bot you saw earlier before all of this madness occurred...
Understood, <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>.

It is also of vital importance that you register your data at one of the control points <sprite name="iconos_mapa_0"> found here in the colony. That way, it will be easier for you to access your data and you will also be able to use the reconstruction system.
Anything else before you head off?
You should go now.
Follow the hillside to the left, and cross the hilltop to the east. There is a path there that will take you towards the other valley.
How to get to Zhagros 05?
Once you get to Zhagros 05, you'll have to climb up to the highest point, simply follow the path. Be careful however, the Cult controls many areas up in the mountains.
How do I find the base?

(Fuck, he's starting to get annoying with all these questions) It's the sacred land of Baba Gojiir, to the west of the Colony. Cross Jumbaba Forest, and you'll see a great door with a leaf symbol engraved on it. Use the required <color=#00FF71>key card </color>to gain entrance.
Jumbaba Valley?
It would be best. Now hurry, and remember, if you find <color=#D93333>Kabor</color> and he sees you: run, run as fast as you can and come inform me.
I'll get going.
Just as I feared... he's done it again... I'm sure this is<color=#D93333> Kabor's</color> doing.
Seeker 178914 Ludovik, this is Baba Rhugga... or what is left of him.
What you saw in the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>'s chamber... that was just a distraction. His real objective was this.
Baba Rhugga...
As you can see... he's placed a pair of horns on his head, much like those of <color=#D93333>Kabor</color> himself. Do you have any idea what it could mean? We don't even know where to start...
This isn't the first body with horns that we have found however... when it all started, this was his way of showing us what he was capable of...
If I'm not mistaken, you are here to find the Colonel...
That's correct. My objective is to find Colonel <color=#D93333>Kabor</color> and inform on his whereabouts, afterwards, it'll be up to you how you intervene.
We'll cross that bridge when we get to it... for now I've lost enough men in these mountains...
That's why I requested the presence of a Seeker.
Although I was hoping you would arrive sooner... during the last few weeks they have taken many of the surrounding areas of the Colony.
What have you found? Have you seen anyone?
No... nobody.
When we arrived it had already happened, although it is very recent.
And all this blood...
Yes... it's not the first time we've seen this either. They sacrifice animals and pour the blood all over the bodies and surrounding area.
We don't know the meaning or reasoning behind it either, or even if it has one. We only know that they have done this before in other occasions.
178914 Ludovik, I will leave immediately for Jumbaba Valley: Baba Gojiir is in danger. I fear they want to kill all the Babas to spread fear amongst the people...
Understood. What's my next step?

Your first mission is to investigate the base they have built in Zhagros 05... however, due to the steep and rugged terrain, it's the area that is hardest to reach ... the bastards have managed to set themselves up in the most elevated areas.
Infiltrate the complex and find any evidence of their crimes. The more information we have, the easier it will be to ask for help. The help I fear we so badly need.

Listen closely Ludovik: you do not want to be seen, they are armed and trigger-happy, they will shoot anything that moves. They wear red, so I'm sure you will spot them easily once you start your ascent up to the Mount.
If you find anything useful, bring it straight to the <color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color>.
Yes, ma'am. At your orders.
As soon as you have finished with this, come and see me in the Valley. There we will begin planning our next step.
You are nothing more than the ashes of a world that is already dead.
Do you have any idea of what hate is? You can't compute it, or understand it. I, have seen it.
You speak only of an error, a simple fault in your central processing system.
A simple fault? Is that what it says in your reports? I'm talking about a blessing.
The flesh has spoken: Rhugga understood, but couldn't bear it.
I'm going to terminate you... Say goodbye to your beloved Mitera.
This symbol...
...Shame, what a shame...
To not be able to cleave open your skull in this precise moment.
I want to feel the wind blow through your rusty metal remains.
Go, find Gojiir, I'm sure he has something important to tell you.
Wait!
Symbol?
I have to keep going and find Gojiir's encampment.
When I find <color=#989347>Lei</color> I'll inform her, but now I must go to Sector 013.
The moss... it covers the skulls of the past.
And who are you? Puny worm...
<color=#D93333>Colonel Kabor</color>.
That name... is from the past. It's sound reminds me of the chains, of the weight of Mitera's shackles.
Although I think I never believed in it as much as you, I can sense your pitiful fervour.
They will come for you, and they will destroy you<color=#D93333> Kabor</color>.
Route's guard?
Where is the Mount of Visions?
The red soldier
Control point system?
Alright, I'll find the guard.
This time... you have gone too far. And you know what?
I like that you are so persistent.
So... obedient.
I can feel the smell, the stench of your mechanisms.
It's similar to that of a biological aroma, I can almost bathe in the putrefaction...
When on the verge of collapse, we all tend to throw ourselves at the things that, because of our circuits, we don't want to know, or even take a glimpse at...
You don't scare me, Colonel. What's more, I pity you, and want to help. Let us repair you, let me take you back to Idrymatos...
The most absolute terror will take hold of you, fragile peon... so tell me... Do you still want to continue? I can free you right now of your sentence.
Do you remember Baba Gojiir? Those damned fanatics have their minds filled with far too many concepts...
<color=#D93333>Colonel Kabor</color>, it's over.
Over? You are starting to become a nuisance...
And this time you won't be able to get away...
Freeze, scum!
Indeed, this time it's over.
Arghhh! How?
Goddammit...
Miserable... look at him run away...
Thank you,<color=#989347> Lei</color>.
No worries... It bothers me that we weren't able to kill him here though...
Head into the temple, Seeker... I'll have a look around also, see if we can get the jump on him...

On a pilgrimage?! Is nobody aware of the current situation and danger? Baba Rhugga was murdered yesterday... and a state of alarm has been declared. Where is Jion? I need to speak with him immediately.
My most sincere apologies, my lady, but nobody here has enough power to question the decisions of the great Baba Gojiir.
He said he had to leave on a sacred pilgrimage.
Where is Jion? I was informed that he was sent to protect this sector.
If you are referring to the soldier, he arrived at sunset. He sat down with the counsel and also tried to deter the great Baba, but it was useless. He then left with the Baba and the escort.
Dammit... and where did they go?
They left as night fell, and were headed towards the Nanaar Jungles. We believe they were headed to the sacred land of the ancients.
Sector 013... I don't like this at all, those are dangerous territories and by my understanding, the Cult has set up many encampments in that area.
<color=#989347>Sheriff Lei</color>! We've found this.
What is it, soldier?
... It seems like, a relay fly? Where did you find it?
The boys found it here by the tree, between the bushes.
Bring it immediately to the Colony, it needs a thorough analysis. If it's what I fear it is, it's possible that they were trying to hack Gojiir's mind.
If I'm right, everyone is in grave danger, including Jion and the rest of the escort.
Yes, ma'am.
I don't like the way any of this is going...
Ludovik! You're back already from Zhagros 05?
I found the base, but there was no trace of <color=#D93333>Kabor</color>. What happened here?
The Baba has left... and I fear he will suffer the same fate as Rhugga if we don't find him quickly.

You've arrived just in time, I want you to go to the Nanaar Jungles and follow the trail of this... pilgrimage. If you have to go all the way to Sector 013 to find Baba Gojiir, then so be it. He must be found.
Understood, I'll follow his trail and find the whereabouts of the Baba. You mentioned something about Jion earlier?

Jion is the guard posted at the north tower, he was also the sheriff of the Colony a long time ago. I suppose he was left no choice other than to escort the Baba on his pilgrimage... I need you to find them.
There's no time to lose then, I'll get going.
To get to the Nanaar Jungles, take the road to the west. Pass through the great hollow tree and descend through the valleys until you reach lower ground.
Understood.

I'll leave before sunrise towards the Ishtar temple ruins: we will assign a guard to protect Baba Kiraam. Come and let me know once you've found the encampment, then we can go after <color=#D93333>Kabor</color>.
You can open the map by pressing <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Map">
I've hidden the<color=#00FF71> key card</color> in the Colony. A place so hidden that not even an Oryktum filled, drunk bot could find it.
Jion, the old sheriff of the Colony, and Gojiir's bodyguard, has the<color=#00FF71> key card</color> to Enlil Peaks, atop Zhagros 05.

Baba Kiraam is an artisan, and he has been making these small statuettes out of clay for centuries. His religious followers believe they contain hidden spiritual messages, and dedicate their lives to deciphering them.
The Colony Bar is a place where you can come and relax, chug down a few jugs of Oryktum.
The world of future Babylon hides all kinds of secrets and mysteries for you to discover.
Humans vanished during the great extinction, but cats didn't.
The mysterious symbols that each robot has represent its name and function.
Luckily for us, the Colony is still safe... I hope <color=#989347>Lei</color> and her soldiers can quickly put an end to these <color=#D93333>Kaborists</color>.
Many years ago, I went out towards the jungles, but as I got to the swamps I saw a giant creature with a mouth full of teeth... I'll never go there again.
Welcome to Colony C-Alpha/SynthBabel 07, 4
Watch out with those cult people...
This used to be a peaceful place... seekers running around, enthralled by their searches, constructors moving iron girders...
Everybody was so excited for whatever was inside that Library, but as you can see, things have changed, it's been a long time since those days.

Again! Locked up in this god forsaken colony... Can you believe they've declared another state of alarm?... Right on the day we were going to go recover some lost data units in the mountains with some friends. I'm tired of the<color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color> and her old rusty circuits!
The<color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch</color> processes an enormous amount of information, I'm sure she has done it for the good of the Colony.
…Sure, sure. Whatever you say, suck up.
I will! I've been given work to do out there, and I should get going...
Trust me, this bunch of scrap never works as it should. Its' design is old and its' operations are more than obsolete.
Between you and me, I'm not surprised some people preferred heading out into the jungle. Some may call them degenerates, but I say they are the smartest ones here...
At least they can go and recover lost data units... &#*!.
It's locked using a type V-17 electronic system, I will need a special <color=#00FF71>key card </color>to gain access.
It's missing a recipient where the energy can be injected into.
I find it really suspicious that they were able to sneak into the<color=#D0B9FF> Matriarch's</color> chamber so easily. It's usually well guarded around the clock...
Yes... it is strange... They say that the alarm went off too late, when they had already entered. Those systems are usually impenetrable... or at least they used to be.
What more can we do? We've already tried everything...
And to top it off, this engine is useless without a good shell.
Shht! I think that guy can hear us.
Indeed.
What are you guys doing here by yourselves?
This is our favorite spot, no one usually bothers us here.
It does seem like you guys are a little bored though.
Hang on! This guy looks like a Seeker! They say they are good at finding things.
I doubt he'll be able to help... you screwed up real good this time, dude.
What's up? Don't tell me you've also lost something.
Well, this smart ass really out did himself a few days ago: he dropped his flute and we've been trying to get it back, but it's impossible to reach.
Ugh.. It took us such a long time to get Ion to help us make it...
You don't have to keep reminding everyone over and over again...
Where did you drop the flute?
In that pipe.
I know right... can you believe it?
Out of all the places he could have dropped it... butterfingers here had to go and find the one place where it's impossible to retrieve.
And without the flute... well, here we are...
We'll have to go ask Ion for another one.
You know Ion will just tell us to fuck off... right?
Eh...
I might be able to help, I have been programmed for worse situations.
If you say so...
I just need the right tool. If I can, I'll help get your flute back for you.
Heh, good luck with that, Seeker!
Yeah! Let's see if what they say about you guys is true!
Fuck man! The Seeker got the flute back!
I knew it! You all owe me 15 data units, losers!
Shit...
Tst...
Ha! I guess we should give him something back for it, right?
The guy really did prove himself.
I know... we can give him this engine, we haven't been able to find a use for it anyway.
Hmmm... the whole drone thing would have been cool, but yeah, maybe he can find a better use for it.
Here you go, we'll give you this engine. I promise it still works!
Just, whatever you do, don't tell Artsege! She turns into a right monster When she gets angry...
Deal.
But first... give us the flute! I'm dying to play it again!
Thank you Seeker!
Remember, if you want to give, place or use an item from your inventory, you have to get close until the <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Interact"> symbol appears.
Then, open your inventory <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Inventory"> and use the item.

Greetings, Seeker, I see you are new here. Would you like me to tell you how the map works?

That's the spirit, Seeker.
Alright, let's have a look: you can open the map by pressing <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Map">
Once you've opened the map, you might not see a whole lot, as it will only show you what you have already discovered.

If you find a teleport type control point <sprite name="TELEPORT POINT_0"> , activate it. That way you'll be able to return to that point whenever you want, by opening the map and selecting the desired location using <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Continue">

You'll see that each zone has various characteristics that are shown in the icon legend  <sprite name="iconos_mapa_0">    <sprite name="iconos_mapa_1">    <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">    <sprite name="iconos_mapa_5">
<sprite name="iconos_mapa_0"> Is the number of control points in each area. Once you have activated all of them, it'll appear in green <sprite name="iconos_mapa_6">
<sprite name="iconos_mapa_1"> Is the number of chests hidden in the area. Once you have found them all, it'll appear in green <sprite name="iconos_mapa_7">
<sprite name="iconos_mapa_5"> Is the number of items that you still have to collect. Once you have taken them all, it'll appear in green <sprite name="iconos_mapa_11">
Lastly, <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4"> is the number of hidden items you can find using your tracker. Once you've found them all, it'll appear in green <sprite name="iconos_mapa_10">
For now, that is all. Don't worry, you'll familiarise yourself with it as you go along... this is all basic stuff for a Seeker such as yourself.

When you're on your travels you'll see various control points <sprite name="iconos_mapa_0">
Some of them you'll see have this symbol <sprite name="TELEPORT POINT_0">, like the one we have in the Colony.
If they have this symbol <sprite name="TELEPORT POINT_0"> it means they are a teleport type control point.
Once activated, you'll be able to open the map using <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Map"> and travel to a location of your choosing.
And if you've already activated a teleporter there, press <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Continue"> to travel to it directly.

A tracker is the perfect companion for any Seeker. It is capable of detecting and picking up hidden items that are in hard to access areas.
I think Ezequias has one in his bazaar, you should definitely ask him about it...
I'm sure he'll ask for a hefty amount of data units <sprite name="cristal_0"> for it though, so you'll have to go find some first.

"How to use the S-KR tracker "
Here is all the information on how to use it:
To start with, just by having it on you, the tracker is capable of detecting hidden objects <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">
That means that even if it's not equipped, the tracker will emit a sound when you are near a hidden object <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">

You'll see that the sound will guide you to the position of a hidden object <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">. It'll change pitch depending on the distance to the hidden object <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">, getting higher as your approach and lower as you move further away.
Once you hear that high pitched sound, access your inventory with <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Inventory"> and press<color=#00FFD9> "Use" </color>on the tracker to equip it.

You'll be close-by, so press <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Left"> and move the tracker around using the directional buttons until you find where the hidden object <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4"> is.
Make sure to have some patience when using the tracker, but if you hear that high pitched sound, you know you're close, even if you can't see it.
Once the tracker has found the hidden object <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">, press <sprite name="{CurrentController}_Interact"> to pick it up, as you would a normal item.
And that's everything! Sometimes it can be difficult to find hidden objects <sprite name="iconos_mapa_4">, but its definitely worth it. Good luck!

Have you ever wondered what these crystals <sprite name="cristal_0"> are exactly?
They form in the atmosphere, in areas where large amounts of data pass through and accumulate.

The central antenna is constantly sending out information to Idrymatos; it's what generates these currents. Thing is, there are places where there is such a concentration of data that they materialise and form these crystals <sprite name="cristal_0">
Most of the time they end up being blown away by the wind, or washed away by the rain. But sometimes, the crystals <sprite name="cristal_0"> are large enough that they end up falling to the ground.

I've been told that you can find many of these clusters around the Colony, which means two things: that it's a good data mine, without a doubt, but also that they should optimise the collection system and improve the network.
Remember that every crystal <sprite name="cristal_0"> that falls to the ground represents an excess, a symptom of an overloaded network.

There are then ways to process them: if submitted to high enough pressures, they become much more compact crystals, and contain more data in less space; that's when they acquire that lilac, or violet tone that you see.
Anyway, as a Seeker, the best way would be to explore the outskirts of the Colony, and try not to get destroyed too many times.
I believe that Mitera covers the reconstruction costs, unless the Seeker has data units <sprite name="cristal_0"> in their possession.

You should also speak to Atsege by the way, the Seeker here in the Colony. I believe she has some form of arrangement with the Archive where she can get large amounts of data units <sprite name="cristal_0"> thanks to some investigation drone she has built.
Good luck on your travels, Seeker.

Entertaining the confined

It's the largest MultiBase of data that currently exists. It's nucleus can be found in what is known as the Idrymatos Labyrinth, a complex system of storage that processes and organises the data arriving from the Colonies and analysts.

Management of the Archive is sub-delegated through various Miterian organisations, legislating entities and analysts that regulate the data side by side with Mitera, checking the data's veracity and type.
The School of Oracles was created in the beginning due to the excess influx of data that continuously arrived at the Archive.

The analysts, created to analyse and categorise knowledge, found themselves overwhelmed with interpretation problems when confronted with certain texts, especially those related to theology, religion and philosophical thought.
Certain texts were known to have left a few analysts frozen, or simply taken hundreds of years to extract conclusions that were, often times, completely contradictory.

That's why the School was born: Mitera proper described them as a “variation” on the analysts, with extra functionality added, and some taken away. It turned them into “Saints”, entities that regulated abstract knowledge, capable of assimilating or coping with concepts such as infinity.
C-Alpha/SynthBabel 07, 4 is one of the most controversial sources of data ever registered by Mitera.
Its' discovery is fairly recent, as the jungle had kept it hidden for a long time, far from the detectors and scanners of ancient monuments.

Not long after its' discovery, I was sent here and the Colony, hastily built. Access to the inside was barred, and only those of the highest ranks of Mitera and workers for the construction, such as <color=#D93333>Colonel Kabor</color>, were allowed in.
Even I don't have some of the interior areas mapped, I just receive the data... an overwhelming amount of it, so much so that I've had to limit it and even ask for enhancements to my capabilities.
As I'm sure you've seen on your journey from Idrymatos, we are in a remote area covered by jungles, with difficult access and poorly explored.
To the north there's the region of Zhagros 05, a steep ridge that extends various kilometres to the west.
To the south-east of here is the Jumbaba Valley and the great Nanaar jungle, an almost infinite extension of dense vegetation that covers the lower swamps, known as Sector 013.

I don't recommend going through there unless strictly necessary. A while back the <color=#D93333>Kaborist cult</color> set up various encampments in the area and in some of the ruins, and the jungle creatures don't exactly facilitate movement through the region.
To the north-east are the Ishtar Temple Ruins, which form part of the C-Alpha/SynthBabel 07, 4 cluster. They are but the superficial remains of the much larger Library complex.

<color=#D93333>Colonel Kabor</color> was one of the pioneers of this Colony, in fact he was part of the first team that was sent to the area. He helped build the infrastructure and design its' foundations. He was later sent to the interior of the Library where he was supposed to continue further transport and assembly operations.

After a few months, he was recalled and assigned a small period of inactivity, something which is commonplace amongst constructors after such large pieces of work, to check for any deterioration they may have suffered, and to inspect the infrastructure.

Those that knew him best said that when he came out of the Library he wasn't himself any more. He had always been diligent, precise and hard working in his tasks, but after the Library, he would wander aimlessly, and spend many nights rigid, looking up at the sky.

On one occasion, it was even necessary to subdue him after a sudden panic attack where he couldn't stop barking the words “Terror” and “Flesh”. He was subjected to a technical examination but no extensive faults were found, only wear and tear natural of someone in his line of work.
Despite this, his behaviour was exceedingly abnormal, so a transfer order was put in for him to be taken to Idrymatos for a more extensive analysis.

And he never returned. We know that a few kilometres from the Zhagros ridge he completely destroyed the caravan that was transporting him, tearing apart the seven soldiers that accompanied him. He then disappeared into the jungle.
The authorities searched for months, but he had quickly familiarised himself with his surroundings, and so the search was ultimately called off, considering him to be lost.
For a long time, nobody knew anything about him or his whereabouts, until strange things started occurring: various bodies were found with horns stuck to their heads, and vastly mutilated bodies.

These occurrences weren't linked to <color=#D93333>Kabor</color> until bots started appearing, saying they were part of the “Kaborist Cult”, a group that quickly grew in number, proclaiming that they had “seen the truth”, having assimilated various pieces of knowledge that Kabor himself had shown them.
And so, the Cult was born. Since then, they haven't stopped growing and acquiring adepts, right to the point where they now control a large part of the northern sector of the Colony.
Accessing information on the subclass Seeker...
A Seeker is an entity created in Mitera (01f1-03) whose objectives consist of searching the world and its' most well hidden corners.

Depending on its' destination, the Seekers are assigned a <color=#FFF400>K-ME1</color> unit, functional mounts that, other than being used as a form of transport, can send, receive and decode encrypted data.
Seekers are also linked to the Control Point <sprite name="iconos_mapa_0"> infrastructure, allowing them to be reconstructed at these stations, following law Iofur-Mel06

The cost of these reparations will be paid for by Mitera, unless the Seeker has enough data units in its' possession. If an anomaly is found in its' behaviour, the station will also proceed to repair the unit.
Come back whenever you like, the servers are at your disposal.
